name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
On May 5, the Central Committee of the Communist Youth League published an article exposing that the US Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) used a non-traditional regime change technology called "swarming" to promote young people connected by the Internet to join the "shoot and move to another place" mobile protest activities and implement "color revolutions."
The article pointed out that the CIA first provides encrypted network communication services. In order to help protesters in some countries in the Middle East keep in touch and avoid being tracked and arrested, an American company (allegedly with a US military background) has developed a TOR technology ("Onion Router" routing technology) that can access the international Internet but cannot be tracked. The relevant servers encrypt all information flowing through them, thereby helping specific users to surf the Internet anonymously. After the project was launched by American companies, it was immediately provided free of charge to anti-government personnel in Iran, Tunisia, Egypt and other countries to ensure that those "dissident youth who want to shake the rule of their own government" can avoid the censorship and surveillance of the local legitimate government when participating in activities.

The second is to provide offline communication services. In order to ensure that anti-government personnel in Tunisia, Egypt and other countries can still keep in touch with the outside world when the Internet is disconnected, Google and Twitter in the United States quickly launched a dedicated service called "Speak2Tweet", which allows users to dial and upload voice messages for free. These messages are automatically converted into tweets and then uploaded to the Internet, and publicly released through platforms such as Twitter to complete the "real-time reporting" of the scene of the incident.

The third is to provide on-site command tools for rallies and marches based on the Internet and wireless communications. The Rand Corporation of the United States has spent several years developing a non-traditional regime change technology called "swarming" to help a large number of young people connected through the Internet join the "shoot one shot and change one place" mobile protest activities, which greatly improves the efficiency of on-site command of the event.

The fourth is that a US company developed a software called "riot". The software supports 100% independent wireless broadband networks, provides variable WiFi networks, does not rely on any traditional physical access methods, does not require telephone, cable or satellite connections, and can easily avoid any form of government monitoring. With the help of the above powerful network technology and communication technology means, the CIA has planned, organized and implemented a large number of "color revolution" events around the world.

Fifth, the US State Department has made the development of an "anti-censorship" information system an important task and invested more than 30 million US dollars in the project.

Therefore, it is particularly important for domestic government agencies, scientific research institutions, industrial enterprises and commercial institutions to quickly "see" and deal with the highly systematic, intelligent and covert cyber attacks launched by the CIA against China in the first place. The report recommends that in order to effectively respond to imminent network and real threats, China should organize self-inspection and self-examination of APT attacks as soon as possible while adopting independent and controllable domestic equipment, and gradually establish a long-term defense system to achieve comprehensive and systematic prevention and control to resist advanced threat attacks.
